Description: Body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style or Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed black with part of lotus flower in added white outline with added red centre; exterior: painted decoration consisting of goat (part of head remaining) to right.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leipzig, Institut für Klassische Archäologie und Antikenmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The sherd was lost in WWII. Lemos places the sherd within the Wild Goat Style, but Wild Goat Style chalices do not have interior decoration. It ought to be also pointed out that goats become very rare in the Chian repertoire after circa 610BC. This sherd may mark a transition from the Wild Goat Style to Mature Animal Style.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 253, no. 416, pl. 56, no. 416)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0405) (phase 2)
